item.title: Azure çš„äº”åå€‹å°åŠ‡å ´...ä¹‹ Kusto.Explorer: Desktop Application for Azure Data Explorer/ADX
item.description:
According to previous post, you can create a free adx/kusto cluster on https://dataexplorer.azure.com/publicfreecluster. Also, the online ADX explorer is good for beginner to start.

However the experimental KQL syntax only exists on your browser cache, cannot sharable, visualize, or versioning. I would like to introduce this desktop application to empower the data engineering performance.

item.title: Learn english from Ubuntu 22.04 Codename
item.description: å¾ Ubuntu Codename å­¸é»è‹±æ–‡ (?) â€˜Jammy Jellyfishâ€™ Jammy is an interesting adjective. Broadly speaking it means to be filled with jam (what Americanâ€™s call jelly) or something that has the consistency of jam. But the word â€˜jammyâ€™ is also used informally in the UK to mean someone or something that is very lucky or fortunate, e.g., â€œthat jammy cat had an extra plate of milk!â€. Jellyfish is â€œa sea creature with a body like jelly and long thin parts called tentacles that can give a sharp sting,

item.title: VIM: indent for multiple lines or comment block
item.description: Indenting On the first line you would like to mark to indent, enter to visual mode: (Press Ctrl+v) Move cursor down to the last line for indent Press > to indent Comment Block On the first line you would like to mark to indent, enter to visual mode: (Press Ctrl+v) Move cursor down to the last line for indent Press Shift+i, then Press #

item.title: How to add Category list into your octopress
item.description: Following Eddie’s blog entry. Thank you, Eddie! :-) Steps: Download the categories rb file into octopress plugins directory Modify your _config.yml rake generate; rake deploy Reference: http://blog.eddie.com.tw/2011/12/05/add-catetories-to-sidebar-in-octopress/

item.title: How to add [Read on] more link
item.description: Simply add ‘more’ in the ’’ into the post where you want to add the more link. Be sure there has some text before more link except Reference link. Reference: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13538047/octopress-index-page/13552502#13552502

item.title: clone your octopress from two machines
item.description: I used MacBook Pro 09’ & Thinkpad X220 at work and chromebook at home. Need the solution to work out the blogging with octopress… Reference: http://blog.zerosharp.com/clone-your-octopress-to-blog-from-two-places/
